A local newspaper publisher of Catanduanes News Now was shot dead by an unidentified assailant in Barangay San Isidro, Virac, Catanduanes on 19 Dec 2016 after releasing an article on drug manufacturing on the island.
A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men and found dead in Barangay Bayan Luma 2, Imus City on 19 Dec 2016.

The Abu Sayyaf is suspected to have kidnapped four fishermen whose boat was found in the Celebes Sea on 20 Dec 2016. The police is looking into the possibility of the fishermen being taken to Sulu province.
A drug suspect was killed in a police raid in Barangay Igulot, Bocaue, Bulacan on 20 Dec 2016.

Two drug suspects were wounded in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men in Purok Sigay, Barangay 2, in Bacolod city, Negros Occidental on 20 Dec 2016. Two more people were wounded in the attack.
Between 8 December 2016 and 3 January 2017, government forces and paramilitary forces damaged two Lumad run community schools in Davao de Oro.
Two drug suspects were killed during a police raid at Manila, Metro Manila on 21 Dec 2016 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

A female drug suspect was seriously wounded in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men in Barangay Plainview, Mandaluyong, Metro Manila on 21 Dec 2016. A bystander was also wounded in the attack.

A drug suspect was killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List. His/Her body was found at Jaen town, Nueva Ecija on 21 Dec 2016 with a sign saying, 'Adik ako wag tularan merry xmas' (I'm an addict; don't emulate me. Merry Christmas) as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men in Barangay San Antonio, Binan City, Laguna on 21 Dec 2016. A bystander was also shot dead in the attack and another one wounded.

A barangay councilor was shot dead by an armed assailant in Barangay Bukal, Taysan, Batangas on 22 Dec 2016. The victim's companion, a councilor, was wounded.

Suspected Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) set off an improvised bomb along the highway in Poblacion, Shariff Aguak, Maguindanao on 22 Dec 2016. The blast location was about a kilometre away of the headquarters of the Army's 2nd Mechanized Infantry Brigade.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives

A drug suspect was shot at yet remained unhurt in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men on the Paoay-Batas road, Ilocos Norte on 23 Dec 2016. His daughter was wounded in the attack.

A farmer activist and Secretary-General of Aguman dareng Maglalautang Campangan (AMC), a provincial chapter of the Alyansa ng mga Magbubukid sa Gitnang Luzon (AMGL), was shot dead in Barangay San Jose, Floridablanca, Pampanga on 24 Dec 2016. Karapatan claims it to be an extrajudicial killing by suspected state agents (assumed military).

Unidentified assailants hurled a grenade at a police car parked in front of a Catholic church in Midsayap, Cotabato on 24 Dec 2016. At least 13 people were wounded, including a police officer. The perpetrators are unknown.
At least three individuals, including one police officer, were wounded by a bomb set off by unidentified assailants at a church in Midsayap town, Cotabato province on December 24, 2016.

Two feuding factions of the Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF) (led by of Ali Rajahmuda and Commander Tanda respectively) clashed in Banisilan area, North Cotabato between 25 - 27 Dec 2016. 7 people from Rajahmuda's faction and 10 people from Tanda's faction were killed over the initial three days of the clash.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: A drug suspect was killed in a police raid in Barangay Santa Monica, Novaliches, Quezon City on 26 Dec 2016.
Arrests: An Abu Sayyaf leader was arrested while being treated in a hospital in Zamboanga City on 26 Dec 2016.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men at Quezon City, Metro Manila on 26 Dec 2016 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: Two drug suspects were killed during a police raid at Danao City, Cebu on 26 Dec 2016 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

Two feuding factions of the Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF) (led by of Ali Rajahmuda and Commander Tanda respectively) clashed in Banisilan area, North Cotabato between 25 - 27 Dec 2016. 7 people from Rajahmuda's faction and 10 people from Tanda's faction were killed over the initial three days of the clash.
A drug suspect was killed in a police raid in Barangay Bagong Barrio, Pandi, Bulacan on 27 Dec 2016.

Two feuding factions of the Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF) (led by of Ali Rajahmuda and Commander Tanda respectively) clashed in Banisilan area, North Cotabato between 25 - 27 Dec 2016. 7 people from Rajahmuda's faction and 10 people from Tanda's faction were killed over the initial three days of the clash.
Four drug suspects were killed in a police raid in Cainta, Rizal on 27 Dec 2016.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: Five drug suspects were killed in an armed attack by unidentified armed men in Caloocan City on 28 Dec 2016. Two more civilians, including a pregnant woman, were killed in the incident. The attack is suspected to be linked to a feud involving drugs.

An improvised bomb exploded along a highway in Bagangan (Pagangan), Aleosan, Cotabato on 28 Dec 2016. At least seven people were wounded. The attack is being blamed on the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF).
Non-violent activity: Two unidentified assailants threw two grenades at a police headquarters compound in Shariff Aguak, Maguindanao on 28 Dec 2016. The grenades failed to explode.

Two improvised bombs exploded in a crowded park in Hilongos, Leyte on 28 Dec 2016 as people were watching a boxing match. At least 33 people were wounded. Another bomb had been planted in front of a church in Hilongos but did not explode. The police is suspecting the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) and the Maute group.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Quezon City, Metro Manila on 28 Dec 2016 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

assoc_actor_2: Drug Suspects (Philippines); Government of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: A drug suspect and barangay chairman was killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men at Lemery town, Batangas on 28 Dec 2016 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect and person with disability was killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men at Mandaue City, Cebu on 28 Dec 2016 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.
Two drug suspects were killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men at Pasay City, Metro Manila on 29 Dec 2016 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.
The mayor of Pantar, Lanao del Norte was shot dead by an unidentified assailant in Barangay Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte on 29 Dec 2016. His two escorts were wounded.

Striking drivers of the DLTB Bus Co. blew up five buses inside the company's terminal in Barangay Malinis, Lemery, Batangas on 29 Dec 2016. The drivers are demanding higher salaries and 13th month pay.

New People's Army guerrillas killed the chief of the tribal paramilitary Mandaya Ancestral Defence Unit (MANADU) and two of his armed aides who were allegedly extorting money from fellow members at Sitio Calatagan, Barangay Poblacion, Caraga town in Davao Oriental on December 30. Four guerrillas were wounded in the battle. The military refuted the claims of the NPA and said that members of a lawless armed group were behind the killings.
Suspected Abu Sayyaf militants detonated an improvised bomb outside the city hall in Lamitan City, Basilan on 30 Dec 2016.
Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) militants attacked villagers and soldiers in Barangay Nabalawag, Midsayap town area on December 30. No casualty was reported.

Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) militants simultaneously attacked roadside Army detachments of the 1st Mechanized Brigade in Salibo town area in Maguindanao, triggering a firefight with soldiers. The Army fired artilleries at rebel positions while Air Force planes provided cover for troops battling the BIFF on the ground. The fighting lasted from 7:00 pm Friday (Dec 30) until shortly before dawn Saturday (Dec 31). No soldier was hurt in the firefight. About 7 militants were killed and five others were wounded. (Fatalities have been divided for the days of Dec 30 and Dec 31.)

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Novaliches, Quezon City, Metro Manila on 30 Dec 2016 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.
Policemen engaged the fleeing New People's Army members who had killed a Mandaya chieftain and his two relatives in Caraga town, Davao Oriental on December 30.
Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) militants attacked a military post in Pigcawayan town area assumed on December 30. No casualty was reported.

A roadside bomb, allegedly plated by Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) militants, detonated along a thoroughfare in Sultan Sumagka area (formerly Talitay) in Maguindanao at noon on December 31. No one was hurt.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Ormoc City, Leyte on 31 Dec 2016 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.
Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) militants attacked an Army base at Barangay Elian in Datu Saudi Ampatuan, Maguindanao assumed on December 31. No casualty was reported.

Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) militants simultaneously attacked roadside Army detachments of the 1st Mechanized Brigade in Salibo town area in Maguindanao, triggering a firefight with soldiers. The Army fired artilleries at rebel positions while Air Force planes provided cover for troops battling the BIFF on the ground. The fighting lasted from 7:00 pm Friday (Dec 30) until shortly before dawn Saturday (Dec 31). No soldier was hurt in the firefight. About 7 militants were killed and five others were wounded. source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: A drug suspect was killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men in Barangay Poog, Toledo City, Cebu on 31 Dec 2016.

About 30 Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) militants, led by Commander Tato Pauya and Commander Tong, attacked an Army base in Barangay Nabalawag, Midsayap area on December 31, triggering a firefight with soldiers of the 34th IB until about 1 a.m. on New Year's Day. The wife of a soldier was injured in the firing.
